title: Barbacoa Tacos
description: These barbacoa tacos are packed with smoky shredded beef that's perfectly tender. Spices like cumin complement the chiles, while oregano and bay leaves add an earthiness to this recipe.

steps.instruction: Season the beef chuck roast with salt and pepper. Heat a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat and sear the roast on all sides until browned, about 8 minutes total.
Add the chipotle chiles, onion, garlic, cumin, oregano, bay leaves, and beef broth to the pot. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and transfer to a 325°F oven. Cook for 3 hours or until the meat shreds easily with a fork.
Remove the meat from the pot and shred using two forks. Strain the cooking liquid and return 1/2 cup to the shredded meat along with lime juice.
Warm the tortillas and serve the barbacoa with diced onion, cilantro, and additional lime wedges.

title: Char Burgers
description: These feature a seared exterior with grill marks and smoky flavor that makes them irresistible for summer grilling.

steps.instruction: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Form ground beef into 4 patties, season with salt and pepper.
Grill patties for 4-5 minutes per side for medium doneness, creating nice grill marks.
Add cheese in the last minute of cooking. Toast buns on the grill briefly.
Serve immediately on toasted buns with your favorite toppings.

title: Mexican Street Corn (Elote)
description: Grill until charred, then brush with lime juice and sprinkle with chili powder for an authentic Mexican street food experience.

steps.instruction: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Husk the corn and remove silk.
Grill corn, turning occasionally, until charred all over, about 10-12 minutes.
Brush grilled corn with mayonnaise, then sprinkle with lime juice, chili powder, and cotija cheese.
Serve immediately with lime wedges.

title: Classic Margaritas
description: Fresh lime juice, tequila, and triple sec blended with ice creates the perfect margarita for summer entertaining.

steps.instruction: Rim glasses with lime juice and coarse salt. Fill with ice.
In a cocktail shaker, combine tequila, lime juice, triple sec, and agave syrup with ice.
Shake vigorously for 15 seconds until well chilled.
Strain into prepared glasses and garnish with lime wheels.

title: Cemitas
description: A cemita is a type of Mexican sandwich served on a fluffy sesame seed roll with breaded cutlets, avocado, cheese, and chipotle chiles.

ingredients.item: beef, pork, or chicken cutlets, very thinly pounded
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
ripe medium Hass avocados, halved, pitted, and sliced
homemade or store-bought cemita buns, sesame seed buns, or brioche buns, halved
shredded Queso Oaxaca from 1 (14-ounce) ball of cheese, or fresh mozzarella or string cheese
chipotle chiles from 1 (7-ounce) can whole chipotle chiles in adobo, or pickled jalapeños from 1 (12-ounce) can
papalo leaves, or fresh cilantro leaves

steps.instruction: Set up three shallow bowls: one with flour, one with milk, and one with bread crumbs. Season the cutlets with salt and pepper.
Dredge each cutlet in flour, then dip in milk, then coat with bread crumbs. Set aside on a plate.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the cutlets until golden brown and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
To assemble the cemitas, place a fried cutlet on the bottom half of each bun. Top with sliced avocado, shredded cheese, onion rings, chipotle chiles, and papalo leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil, close the sandwich, and serve immediately.

title: Sundae Milkshake
description: A creamy and fruity milkshake made with vanilla ice cream, blueberries, bananas, and kefir, topped with whipped cream and chocolate syrup.

steps.instruction: In a blender, combine the vanilla ice cream, blueberries, bananas, and kefir.
Blend on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 30-45 seconds.
Pour the milkshake into serving glasses.
Top with whipped cream and drizzle with chocolate syrup before serving.

title: Traditional Sushi (Hosomaki)
description: Traditional Japanese sushi rolls made with seasoned rice, fresh tuna, and cucumber wrapped in nori seaweed.

steps.instruction: Rinse the rice thoroughly until the water runs clear. Cook according to package instructions, then let cool slightly.
Mix the cooked rice with seasoned rice vinegar while it's still warm. Let the rice cool completely.
Slice the cucumber into thin strips and cut the tuna into long, thin strips.
Place a nori sheet on a bamboo mat, shiny side down. Spread a thin layer of rice evenly over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top.
Place tuna and cucumber strips in the center of the rice. Roll tightly using the bamboo mat, moistening the top border with water to seal.
Cut each roll into 6-8 pieces with a sharp, wet knife. Serve with soy sauce and wasabi.

title: Vegan Kebabs
description: Grilled vegetable and soy curl kebabs marinated in a tangy Mediterranean dressing with herbs and garlic.

ingredients.item: medium zucchini, sliced into thick rounds
large yellow summer squash, sliced into thick rounds
red bell pepper, cut into chunks
green bell pepper, cut into chunks

steps.instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, water, dijon mustard, agave, minced garlic, oregano, basil, salt, and black pepper to make the marinade.
Add soy curls and vegetables to the marinade, tossing to coat evenly. Let marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
Thread the marinated vegetables and soy curls onto skewers, alternating between different vegetables and soy curls.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Grill kebabs for 12-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
Serve hot with any remaining marinade drizzled over the top.
